sub_title: I help leaders to successfully lead change. 🌍 International Change Manager and Systemic Leadership Expert.
summary:
Twenty eight years of change management experience, 3000+ successful & engaged clients, and a commitment to helping leaders and executives transform their businesses, boost their ROI's and live happier. 

My mission is to help leaders and organizations change to be successful and happy in life, to do business in an international context, and to add value by enabling, managing and facilitating high quality ROI boosting change, organizational development and leadership projects.

How can I help you? Three great things I do for my clients:

► I design, deliver and lead purpose driven change, leadership and organization development projects
► I offer executive and team coaching that is engaging, systems oriented and progress focused
► I work closely with my clients to build long term, trusted relationships 

My clients are leaders, executives, entrepreneurs and teams in multinational settings, who want to take themselves, their organizations and results to higher levels. 

"We would not have succeeded without your help. Your dedication, enthusiasm and perseverance have ensured that we have changed sustainably, one step at a time during the past period." 
- Raymond Lesage, General Director, Ford Utrecht

"Jennifer challenged me to show strong leadership, to think global & act local, to create alignment in my team and to do what is necessary to actively support the behavioral changes needed for results."
- Max van der Meer, Vice President Operations & Technology, Huntsman Corporation 

My titles MA MMC ORSCC PCC stand for: Master of Arts in Organizational Psychology, Master of Management Consultancy, Organization & Relationship Systems Coach, Professional Certified Coach.

awards.title: Japan Prizewinners Program
awards.description:
The Japan Prizewinners Programme (JPP) was a one-year postgraduate course for outstanding Dutch graduates with a university masters degree, who may aspire to become leaders in Dutch society. Each year up to 20 participants were recruited among the best university graduates in various fields of study. 

The programme consisted of a 4-month high-intensity course of Japanese language and culture at Leiden University, The Netherlands. Upon successful completion of the exams, the students would travel to Tokyo, Japan where they would follow an advanced course of Japanese language for 2 months at the Japan-Netherlands Institute in Tokyo. After this specialist language training the students continued with the core of the programme: a position at a Japanese company or institution, related to their field of study.

The first group of students of the Japan Prizewinners Programme started their training in September 1995. The Dutch Ministry of Education, Culture and Science terminated its support for the program in 2008; the last group of JPP graduates obtained their diplomas in September 2008.
awards.issuer: Ministry of Education, Culture and Science

projects.title: Ford of Europe Consumer Experience Movement (CEM)
projects.description:
The Ford Consumer Experience Movement - designed to transform the dealer-customer relationship into a world-class experience – has been the driving force behind Ford’s keen focus on meaningful customer engagement. Ford’s considerable research (based on the Harvard Service-Profit Chain model) has shown that engagement requires an emotional connection and it is the dealership employees who have to build these relationships. Together with a team of retailers from across the country, Ford developed the CEM initiative that goes well beyond any company program launched to date. The CEM was first launched in the US and Canada, and has expanded globally throughout Europe, Mexico, Asia and numerous other countries around the world. 

The process is designed to provide dealers with comprehensive and valuable insight into their leadership, culture, and employee engagement. Dealers who sign up to participate in the CEM are assigned a professional coach whose role is to help get the best out of the leadership of each dealership. They do not have a process manual of what they need to do. They have tools, resources and skills to help the leadership team better engage their people. With their experience they are able to work together with the dealers who are entrepreneurs, but working within the parameters of a large corporate organization. Eventually it is about creating a positive environment that will create true employee engagement.

contributors.headline: I help leaders to successfully lead change. 🌍 International Change Manager and Systemic Leadership Expert.

projects.title: Presenter & workshop leader at conference on Multiculturalism and African Diaspora
projects.description:
World work project for ORSC certification. The Center for Right Relationship believes that every student who passes through their program has a larger role to play in the evolution of human systems.  As students in their certification program our job was and still is to develop a world work role we are called to play; their job is to inspire and equip you for that function. For this reason, an important part of the Certification process was to develop a World Work Project. In addition to contributing to human relationship systems, this project helped to anchor and leverage my Certification learning.

I certainly felt the calling to develop and shape a world work role. The purpose of my world work project was to:
> Contribute to the world and shape my world work role as a professional with a systems approach
> Put my ORSC skills out there and apply ORSC tools
> Create mutual understanding and celebration between people
> Bring love & connection in times of change
> Have another excuse to travel and be in a country I love.

My project was to write and present my paper on the topic of Understanding and Celebrating Diversity at the conference on Multiculturalism and the prospects for Africa and African Diaspora development (organized by CBAAC, Nigeria and the State University of Bahia, Salvador, Brazil). Furthermore, I designed and delivered a workshop for 70 conference participants. In this workshop the participants discovered their own frame of reference and explored that of someone else. Through the experience of various ORSC tools they found new ways to look at themselves, others and the wider context of multiculturalism and diversity.

projects.title: Journey to Brilliance - Logica Leadership & Culture Change project
projects.description:
Client: CEO, Board, HR Director and top 3 layers of leaders of multinational IT organization (Benelux region, 6000 employees). Led a project team of 25 professionals, project involved 375 leaders. 
Main goal: to (co)create leadership and employee behavior that supports the new strategy, substantially improves the business and leads all talent that is present in the organization towards enhanced client relationships and the highest performance.
Driving factors: new strategy, employee value proposition, customer value proposition
My role: project leader.

profile_positions.description:
I work for leaders, executives, managers and multinationals as an independent Change Manager, Certified Team Coach and Executive Coach. I help you make transformations in your business, teams and you as a leader to realize better results. Whether you want to tackle deeply rooted ineffective organizational behavior, or if you want to prepare your people and organization for tomorrow’s demands. I specialize in culture change, leadership development, organization development and systemic leadership. Have a look below for my most recent clients and projects. 

Services: change leadership & change management, executive & leadership team coaching and development. More information available on www.jennifercampbell.com.

Get in touch:
📞 +31 - 850020090
✉️ info @ jennifercampbell.com
profile_positions.title: Senior Change Manager - Executive (Team) Coach - Systemic Leadership Expert

profile_positions.description:
The Systemic Leadership Summit is a global event with a simple mission - to help create a shift in your leadership paradigm and dramatically grow and spread the transformation capabilities of leaders like you. 

How? By introducing you to a cutting edge, experienced group of influencers. Thought leaders, experts and wise individuals from across the world, who live and breathe systemic approaches and who embody a paradigm shift towards a new collective focused leadership. The Systemic Leadership Summit is online, so you can attend wherever and however you can find an internet connection. Enjoy over 20-25 content-packed speaker sessions per summit. You'll be able to enjoy different speakers from business, academic and coaching perspectives who share their knowledge and experience with leadership from a systemic perspective.

The fifth and upcoming edition of the Systemic Leadership Summit will take place January 17-24, 2021. Have a look at our 2020 speaker line-up on the summit home page: http://systemicleadershipsummit.com (the 2021 speaker line-up will be available November 2020)

The first edition of the Systemic Leadership Summit was held January, 2017, 

We celebrate an amazing success of this online event, for which we've had over 4500 participants from 48 different countries across the world! We've had participants from:

Algeria, Argentina, Australia, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, Congo, Finland, Germany, Hungary, India, Japan, Netherlands, Poland, Romania, Russian Federation, Saudi Arabia, South Africa, Sweden, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, and more…!

Contact me if you need help with:
* Organizing and launching your own online summit or online conference
* Being a speaker for the summit
* Participating in the summit

Get in touch:
📞 +31 - 850020090
✉️ info @ jennifercampbell.com

volunteer_experiences.description:
As Vice President LOM Kromme Rijn I was part of the board to lead our chapter for a year in terms of vision, goals, projects and activities. Chapter Kromme Rijn is located in the Netherlands. 

Junior Chamber International (JCI) is the only worldwide non-political and non-sectarian youth service organization. It is an international community of citizens between the ages of 18 to 40 with the aim and purpose of creating positive changes in the world. The organization believes that these changes must result from one taking "collective action to improve themselves and the world around them." JCI mission: To provide development opportunities that empower young people to create positive change. JCI vision: To be the leading global network of young active citizens.
As Project Manager JCI-I I led the interaction between local and international (country) board members in the Netherlands.

volunteer_experiences.role: Co-organizer and Lead Singer in Music Exchange Charity Project
volunteer_experiences.description: As Co-organizer and Lead Singer in Music Exchange Fundraising Project I was part of a great creative process. The project resulted in a CD which was sold to raise funds for the Radboud Academic Hospital, who conduct research to find cures for children's diseases.
